question: What are genes related to Achromatopsia?
agent_answer:
The following genes are related to Achromatopsia:

1. [CNGA3 (HGNC:2150)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:2150) - Cyclic nucleotide gated channel alpha 3
2. [CNGB3 (HGNC:2153)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:2153) - Cyclic nucleotide gated channel beta 3
3. [OPN1MW (HGNC:4206)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:4206) - Opsin 1, medium wave sensitive (green cone photopigment)
4. [OPN1LW (HGNC:9936)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:9936) - Opsin 1, long wave sensitive (red cone photopigment)
5. [PDE6H (HGNC:8790)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:8790) - Phosphodiesterase 6H, cGMP-specific, cone, gamma
6. [GNAT2 (HGNC:4394)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:4394) - G protein subunit alpha transducin 2
7. [ATF6 (HGNC:791)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:791) - Activating transcription factor 6

These genes have been identified as having a causal relationship with Achromatopsia. There are also genes that have been found to be correlated with the condition:

1. [RPGR (HGNC:10295)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:10295) - Retinitis pigmentosa GTPase regulator
2. [PDE6C (HGNC:8787)](https://monarchinitiative.org/gene/HGNC:8787) - Phosphodiesterase 6C

Please note that the relationship between these genes and Achromatopsia may vary, with some having a direct causal role and others being correlated with the condition.

agent_answer_provenance.content: {"results": [{"id": "MONDO:0018852", "name": "achromatopsia", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "Achromatopsia (ACHM) is a rare autosomal recessive retinal disorder characterized by color blindness, nystagmus, photophobia, and severely reduced visual acuity due to the absence or impairment of cone function."}, {"id": "MONDO:0009003", "name": "achromatopsia 2", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "Achromatopsia 2 is a condition that affects the color vision. Most people have complete achromatopsia which is characterized by a total absence of color vision (only able to see black, white and shades of gray). Rarely, affected people may have incomplete achromatopsia which is associated with some color discrimination. Other common signs and symptoms include reduced visual acuity, involuntary back-and-forth eye movements, increased sensitivity to light (photophobia), and hyperopia (farsightedness). Achromatopsia 2 is caused by changes (mutations) in the CNGA3 gene and is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. Although color discrimination cannot be improved, treatments are available to address some of the other associated symptoms."}, {"id": "MONDO:0009875", "name": "achromatopsia 3", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "Any achromatopsia in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CNGB3 gene."}, {"id": "MONDO:0013465", "name": "achromatopsia 4", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "Any achromatopsia in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the GNAT2 gene."}, {"id": "MONDO:0014677", "name": "achromatopsia 7", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "Any achromatopsia in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ATF6 gene."}, {"id": "MONDO:0800196", "name": "achromatopsia 5", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": null}, {"id": "MONDO:0800197", "name": "achromatopsia 6", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": null}, {"id": "MONDO:0100447", "name": "ATF6-related retinopathy", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "A retinopathy caused by biallelic variants in the AFT6 gene."}, {"id": "MONDO:0800102", "name": "CNGA3-related retinopathy", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "A retinopathy, typically described as achromatopsia, caused by biallelic variants in the CNGA3 gene."}, {"id": "MONDO:0100446", "name": "CNGB3-related retinopathy", "categories": ["biolink:Disease"], "description": "A retinopathy caused by biallelic variants in the CNGB3 gene."}], "total": 15}
